timeline.bodyText:
This is the biggest problem I have with this. I am not a big fan of exposing a method like this. Could we do a bit better?
On an additional note, I think we should probably deprecate execute and friends and just outright replace them with *async variants. We'll clean up the API mess later on.
timeline.author: astei
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -35,10 +35,21 @@
 
   /**
    * Attempts to execute a command from the specified {@code cmdLine}.
+   * CommandExecuteEvent will not called
    *
    * @param source the command's source
    * @param cmdLine the command to run
    * @return true if the command was found and executed, false if it was not
    */
   boolean execute(CommandSource source, String cmdLine);
+
+  /**
+   * Attempts to execute a command from the specified {@code cmdLine}.
+   *
+   * @param source the command's source
+   * @param cmdLine the command to run
+   * @param callEvent will CommandExecuteEvent called or not
+   * @return true if the command was found and executed, false if it was not
+   */
+  boolean execute(CommandSource source, String cmdLine, boolean callEvent);

replies.bodyText: I think its not problem, because execute will be called from event/scheduler thread pool in 99% cases. I think we should not messy this with async stuff.
replies.author: Leymooo

timeline.message: add async methods, also add separate methods which will call event and which will not call event

timeline.author: astei

timeline.bodyText:
source, not invoker
(This is a typo in the original code. Whoops!)
timeline.author: astei
astei

timeline.bodyText: Velocity has no concept of sync. More accurately this could say Attempts to execute a command using the specified {@code cmdLine} in a blocking fashion.
timeline.author: astei

    * @param cmdLine the command to run
